description.content:
Trip Planner is the result application of my bachelor thesis. It connects the Renfe Web Service and the Bicicas Web Service to provide basic trip organization.

The main objective is to locate the user and guide her to the main train station of Valencia. The user is supposed to be in the Valencian region. To achieve this goal, it makes use ofRenfe is the state-owned train company of Spain. Renfe Web Service scans the official Web Site and gathers information about the trains of the regional trains of Valencia.

The official Web Site provides a form for filtering the trains. This Web Service provides an abstraction of the query using classical REST URL style. Behind the scenes, it requests the Renfe's Web Site and search in it the results that matches the query.

There is no database involved in the operations, all the data are processed in real time.

All the credits for the data go to the owners of the service Renfe.

MEIT is a mobile application that allows users to assess their emotional intelligence. The application is grounded in state of the art knowledge in psychology to grade the users emotional intelligence on a scale of 1–121 at hand of some simple visual tests.

The goal of the assignment is to implement a 1-page Web Application that visualizes the aggregate demographic data that is obtained from the MEIT application. In particular, the average score and time to perform the test needs to be visualized on a map, grouped per country, continent, or custom grouping of countries (i.e., the user needs to be able to group countries). Furthermore, it needs to be possible to set certain parameters: gender, age range, date range and tests performed, whereby results should be(dynamically) updateable.

This project is the final project of the programming course of the Master of Science in Geospatial Technologies.

This application shows the values of Light, Temperature and Humidity sensors located on the buildings of the University Jaume I for a given day

The colors indicate the intensity of the sensor values divided in five classes.

This project is a group work for the Master of Science in Geospatial Technologies and was used as a prototype application for an ongoing research project

Note: this project will no longer work due to the removal of the Web Service from which the data are fetched.

Renfe is the state-owned train company of Spain. Renfe Web Service scans the official Web Site and gathers information about the trains of the regional trains of Valencia.

The official Web Site provides a form for filtering the trains. This Web Service provides an abstraction of the query using classical REST URL style. Behind the scenes, it requests the Renfe's Web Site and search in it the results that matches the query.

There is no database involved in the operations, all the data are processed in real time.

All the credits for the data go to the owners of the service Renfe.

Bicicas is a bike sharing service active in the city of Castellón de la Plana (Spain). This Web Service scans the official Web Site and gathers information about the bike's stations. The information is then stored in a MongoDB database for further analysis. Since the Web Site doesn't provide any API or push notification, this project uses polling and scraping strategy for data recovery.

All the credits for the data go to the owners of the service Bicicas.

The application provides the collected data through a REST API.

Note: this project is discontinued due to the work in progress state of the Bicicas Web Site.
